7w2.title: Acceleratr QA
7w2.text:
### What is this all about?

We've been encouraged by the number of awesome people who are on-board with dedicating their efforts towards moving the needle on the world's largest problems. Unfortunately, it seems that the vast majority of them have life circumstances which don't give a clearly available path to fulfilling their potential.

We aim to create a low-cost environment which facilitates rapid personal growth, allowing high-potential individuals become more stable, productive, networked, and more capable of sustained and directed progress towards improving the world over a few months.

### What, exactly, will you offer?

A 3-6 month stay in the accelerator, during which residents can focus on developing the foundations to make progress on the things they think are most important, while doing object level work in order to have feedback loops and build good habits.

Removal of many of life's trivial inconveniences. Fostering social, emotional, and self-improvement support networks. Giving mentorship in the form of [legitimate peripheral participation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legitimate_peripheral_participation) in a [community of practice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Community_of_practice). Contact with others on the same path, and long-term mentorship).



As a movement, EA is doing an amazing job at finding high-potential people and getting them on-board with the idea of trying to fix the world's largest problems. 



Most of the research so far is crowdsourced. If you'd like to help push it forward, please take the survey and you’ll be added to the Facebook chat. Until May, the project is in freeform exploration/discussion mode. Our current target for move-in early 2018, very much subject to change. We have significant funding already (mostly from Eric and other people interested in being part of the founding team), and other sources are interested.

Why?
The people who are actually helping the world have habits and environments (both social and physical) that promote ongoing self-improvement and alignment to their own goals. The EA movement is good at finding people with potential and getting them interested in helping the world, but they’re often stuck in life situations or mental patterns that make taking risks (social, financial, or otherwise) scary. The barrier this poses is surprisingly large, but difficult to notice from the outside if you’re not looking for it. It looks possible to create environments that are able to turn interested people into highly valuable people, without the risks of going it on your own.


Quick overview
What we want the project to be like once it’s up and running.

People
People will mostly be those from the greater EA/rationality network who want to level up.
First week consists of gently guided introduction and induction. They’ll also have an extended discussion with a facilitator to help them assess their skills, motivations, and focus areas for growth.
Some residents pay for their stay by helping with logistics and improvements. Long-term residents also often help improve the location.


Spaces
There will be individual spaces for quietly working, socializing and eating, holding discussions, a workshop, etc. as well as private and shared living spaces.


Norms
Designated, autonomous individuals handle particular task domains, and are selected for caring and good judgement.
People are encouraged to give short public updates on their own progress, at least every few weeks.
Open, helpful communication and productive tension resolution are encouraged and facilitated.

Other
We try to engineer an environment that fosters deep friendships and healthy habits.

Why not a city?
Many people consider living in a city essential. This is reasonable, but the accelerator project will work best near a city, rather than in one, primarily due to cost differences. Many people are living off savings or scholarships, and so reducing cost of living continues to be valuable down to very low expense levels. Additionally, room to expand to 20-50 people on a relatively small budget is far more feasible away from a city. Even this will require heavy optimization and unusual solutions, such as abandoned villages.

Logistics and governance
Eric will provide initial funding, potentially with contributions from EA philanthropists and organizations allowing more flexibility and faster setup time. Transferable shares of the project will be offered during crowdfunding that can be used to pay rent (at a discount rate, to incentivize early contribution).

Governance consists of one dictator who appoints other localized dictators, ability to make decisions without red tape or meetings, and personal responsibility for projects. Provision for removing the primary dictator via a majority shares and/or vote of no confidence by long-term residents.

The project is open to visits (~1 week) by anyone with a current resident as a contact point, or people who come well-recommended. Short term residents are gauged for their compatibility and goals. Long-term residents can veto people they expect to be significantly net-negative.
